title.narrative: Lokaler till org. för mänskliga rättigheter

description.narrative: Contribution aims to provide some CSOs in Mozambique with opportunity to buy premises for their activities, for ex for office space or space for legal aid centers and similar. The support aims to increase democratic participation through CSO participation in society, which will be feasible to a greater degree if CSOs can use budget for other costs than rent, avoid eviction & increase sustainability of orgs/CS

Insatsens syfte är att ge några CSO i Mocambique möjlighet att köpa lokaler för sin verksamhet, t.ex. kontorslokaler men också lokaler till rättshjälps-centra och liknande. Stödet avser öka demokratiutövandet genom CSOs deltagande i samhället vilket möjliggörs till större grad när de kan använda sin budget till annat än hyra, inte hotas av vräkning, och ökar sin bärkraftighet /CS

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: This non-traditional project from a Sida perspective has purchases premises for six CSOs in Mozambique and, hence, helped the organisations to cut overhead costs, to free more of their annual budget for programme implementation, to enable the organisations to rent out office space or meeting rooms to earn additional income and to work in peace without fear from being evicted by landlords who do not approve of their work or just want to increase rents to abhorrent levels. All organisations are reporting that they are already saving costs from office rent and rental of meetings venues (since the premises in all cases can at least cater for smaller events and meetings). Several of the organisations report that they are already considering renting out part of their office to other organisations to also there gain additional financial sustainability. The result of not fearing eviction is complete for all organisations by fact of owning their premises. Most expected results that concern increased financial sustainability and use of "freed" funds for more programme work will be more visible as time elapses. The last premise was only purchased in February 2014. The use of the premised for intended purposes and the achievement of these longer-term results will be monitored by the Embassy of Sweden until 2018. Other results reported that are more direct are the improved ability by client serving organisations (e.g. providing legal assistance) to serve people in need in surrounding that are private and ensure confidentiality. Moreover, organisations report on a perceived increased gain in credibility from society at large when operating from an adequate functional office space.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
